But across technology circles the move by Google-- founded during the first dot-com boom-- to replace CEO Eric Schmidt with the 38-year-old Page left some wondering how the search giant would deal with middle age. Founder becoming CEO... Is this like a Steve Jobs returning or a Jerry Yang returning? Chris Dixon, a technology veteran who has invested in Skype and Foursquare, tweeted. Larry Page speaking to the European Parliament, 2009. An "unexpected shakeup" went down at Google today. Larry Page, company co-founder, will take over as CEO effective April 4. Page, 37, is reclaiming the top job from Eric Schmidt , who had been brought in as CEO a decade ago because Google's investors believed the company needed a more mature leader, reports KTVU.
